job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
- great opportunity for experience for pre-health students
- well organized
cons:
- can be stressful at times and slow at others
- you get less patient contact at main

review_title: Great learning experience for new nurses
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Coworkers, pay, experience, compensation for overtime. I learned a lot especially going in as a new grad, being on your own is comfortable after a few months!
cons: The patients on any floor can be challenging, physically and mentally. That comes along with working bedside. You don’t do everything as a nurse that you would be able to do at the main Jeff hospital. Lab draws, placing an IV, TPN, blood administration is rare for the nurse. The floors are becoming very acute very quickly and they don’t have the equipment to care for the patients, which leads to sending patients to the main hospital. Residents can be challenging to work with.

job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Coworkers and patients are fantastic. Very rewarding job. You learn a great amount. Good job to gain experience before PT school.
cons: The pay could be more

review_title: Avoid this position by any means necessary
job_title: Behavior Technician in Philadelphia, PA
pros: No pros at all whatsoever.
cons: Low pay Disorganized Not a guaranteed thirty minute break Unsure time of when you will leave due to your relief not showing up on time Erratic patients Blunt racism, there are zero black therapist or doctors in higher positions.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Phila, PA
pros: good pay, flexible hours, easy parking, good benefits
cons: not enough bonus, not flexible for education

job_title: Patient Safety Associate in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Healthcare experience Not physically laborious
cons: Low pay Not enough to do to get through the shift

job_title: Physical Therapist in Phila, PA
pros: good mentoring, lots of learning
cons: poor pay, will have to work several weekends and holidays for many years

review_title: great culture, lacking in growth opportunities
job_title: Therapy Aide in Philadelphia, PA
pros: wonderful coworkers, great teamwork, amazing purpose
cons: no professional growth, no salary increase for many years even if you are high performing, change to policies and procedures is slow, systems are almost 20 years old

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Good staffing ratios, moderate stress
cons: Disrespect from upper management, a lot of lip service

job_title: Physical Therapist in Phila, PA
pros: Great team, love the work and available resources to help our patients. Good funds for education and professional development
cons: Pay is on the low end; not the best supervisor support; work life balance support; lack of clinical ladder and career development

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Everyone works as a team, staff is knowledgeable, flexible schedule, plenty OT
cons: Management could communicate better, pay could be better

job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
- flexibility is amazing in the per-diem position, all managers/supervisors work with me to accommodate my schedule
- pay is good for undergraduates looking for healthcare positions
cons: - repetition in job duties/limited patient care opportunities, however it is necessary for the patient's safety

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Flexible schedule, clean work environment, teamwork, great management and great pay for the area
cons: Your shift maybe cancelled last minute.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Philadelphia, PA
pros: The teamwork between staff members is great
cons: The administration can be a bit much...to many chefs in the kitchen type of thing.

job_title: Medical Social Worker in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Staff cares a great amount for patients
cons: Limited administrative support & limited staffing

job_title: Certified Nurses Assistant in Philadelphia, PA
pros: There’s always work If you’re looking for overtime
cons: The workload sometimes is a little heavy

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) in Phila, PA
pros: Good schedule, always plenty of shifts.
cons: Intense at times, very sick patients.

job_title: Therapy Aide in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Patients and staff can be friendly
cons:
- No wage increase
- Difficult to elevate position

job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Staff is very motivated, positive, and encouraging
cons: Gym can be very busy, then very slow, and is always changing what your role consists of.

job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Incredible therapists and management who allow you to work with patients and will educate you on any questions you have.
cons: Short staffed on therapy aides

job_title: Staff RN in Phila, PA
pros: Nurses are able to form a relationship with the pt/family as the pt stay is usually > 3 weeks. Staffing ratios acceptable. Team work depending on the unit/shift.
cons:
Upper management does not care for nursing staff in the least and have an attitude that the nurse is disposable and replaceable. They recently dismantled the weekend nursing program with only 5 week notice. This was very difficult for 
many nurses who have had child care issues. During this transition many nurses are leaving or planning to leave due to fundamental lack of respect exhibited from upper management to staff nursing. Upper management completely out of touch with their staff and their issues regarding scheduling. No accountability for staff members who don't follow the rules and no positive reinforcement for a job  well done. Some CNAs are difficult to work with and management does not support RNs who seek help to rectify incompetent nursing care by CNAs.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Employees that work in hospital are great, hard workers and help patients whenever necessary
cons: Management unfair to their employees, no raises, no bonuses, cuts working hours only in certain departments within the hospital when there census is low. Mainly cuts working hours to non-exempt employees asking them to use there personal time or take it without pay.  Asks exempt employees to use there personal time to cut hours, but management hours never cut, full pay for them.  Very unfair.  No appreciation at all from top levels running the hospital.  They will say they do everything fairly for there employees, but they don't,  only certain employees benefit with perks if you are liked by upper management running the hospital.  Absolutely no room for advancement.  Only nurses n therapists if your lucky...

job_title: Behavior Technician in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Some of the staff was good and I loved the patients I have came across within the 3years I been there.
cons: Management doesn’t follow their code of conduct. They inforce the rule for some and not others. I was recently terminated from this job from something that I did not do. And they claimed they did an investigation but from my understanding they talked to people that did not like me. And the ones they did talk to that I was okay with told them the truth about everything and they still terminated me. And I never had a write up or anything under my belt.

job_title: Utilization Review Coordination Nurse in Bensalem, PA
pros: Great place to work.  The nurses, therapists, aides are all top notch!  Its small enough where you get to know almost everyone who works there by name.
cons: Its small so every dollar counts.  The loss of the affiliation from Jefferson was disappointing from a staff viewpoint. The change in benefits was noticeable. Being that it is a stand alone rehab, the opportunities to advance are very limited.  Nepotism is alive and well here, sadly.

review_title: It's a very close knit work environment.
job_title: Nurse Aide in Philadelphia, PA
pros: The people you work with are pretty friendly and try and help eachother out. They are pretty flexible with making work schedules. Free parking garage, discount meals at the cafe.
cons: Well I was a Nurse Assistant, and with that came a lot of cleaning patients after going to the bathroom. So if you have a weak stomach or really don't get pleasure from helping others then this is not the job for you. But it will make you more grateful with so like things like being able to get up out of the bed by yourself.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Love working with patients and most of the floor staff is great to work with....there’s some bad ones back what job doesn’t have them.
cons: There’s two managers in the building and there’s only one good one, she amazing!!. The other manager is horrible!!!....he shows favoritism to some of workers!!....and will treat the other staff real bad!!..always talking about somebody to other staff members!....if he didn’t like you he’ll start building a file to terminate you!....working under him is like walking on eggshells!!....so if your thinking about working at magee Did not work on his floors!....also getting time off is impossible!! Especially on weekends they asks to find your own coverage!!....and then deny it last minute because it put somebody in overtime!....YOU DONT GET RAISES HERE AT ALL!!!

job_title: Speech Language Pathologist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Wonderful interdisciplinary collaboration, team-work, communication across staff and employees, updated facilities and equipment, individualized patient care, support for caregivers, education provided to patients and families
cons: Opportunities for growth and development within discipline, exposure to specific treatment methods and availability of mentorship

job_title: Behavioral Technician in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Learn about brain, stroke and spinal injuries and the recovery process.
cons: No raises and difficult growing into other departments or higher up positions. Also they’ve cut the shift differentials.

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Phila, PA
pros: Great management, company benefits and awesome company culture. Sorry I left there.
cons: None, that I can think of. I left to take an advancement opportunity.

job_title: Neuropsychologist in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Great people, interesting work, very good benefits and vacation.
cons: Low Salary for doctoral level work, not much room for promotions or raises.

review_title: Not the best but not the worst

review_title: It's a good experience and place to start if you are entering the workforce

review_title: A place for Passionate people to work.
